intro: Psychotria mahonii var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, hairy pubescence. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent, spurred calyx. This variety is often found in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests.
